reporting-org.narrative: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria

title.narrative: Scaling up Innovative Approaches to Respond to TB Challenges and Strengthening Health Systems Initiatives in Afghanistan

description.narrative: Afghanistan - Tuberculosis - Ministry of Public Health of the Islamic Republic of Afghanistan - MoPH. This program has the following goals: To reduce TB mortality by 50% at the end of 2021 compared to 2015. To strengthen the health system to reduce mortality and morbidity associated with ATM and RMNCH. The objectives of this program are: To increase the case notification of all TB cases at least 8 % per year and to maintain treatment success rate at least 90% by 2021. To detect and treat at least 50% of estimated MDR-TB cases by 2021. To increase access of women and children to health care services for RMNCAH, HIV, TB and malaria, reduced stigma and discrimination and promotion of health lifestyles in the community and in health facilities in underserved areas. To maintain and improve the quality of the National Laboratory Network. To improve institutional capacity of Civil Society Organizations and private sector for effective implementation of TB, Malaria and HIV. To ensure high quality pharmaceuticals and health commodities by strengthening the supply chain, procurement, management, Quality Assurance and regulatory systems. To improve the data quality of the HMIS and strengthen the utilization of data for decision-making at all levels

title.narrative: Outcome indicator for AFG-T-MOPH
Treatment success rate of RR TB and/or MDR-TB: Percentage of cases with RR and/or MDR-TB successfully treated

National aggregate HMIS fully deployed and functional: Percentage of HMIS components in place (HIS deployment, completeness, timeliness, and integration of aggregate disease reporting for HIV, TB and malaria indicators)
Treatment success rate of all forms of TB - bacteriologically confirmed plus clinically diagnosed, new and relapse cases

TB treatment coverage: Percentage of new and relapse cases that were notified and treated among the estimated number of incident TB cases in the same year (all form of TB - bacteriologically confirmed plus clinically diagnosed)
Case notification rate of all forms of TB per 100,000 population - bacteriologically confirmed plus clinically diagnosed, new and relapse cases
Percentage of women attending antenatal care

Notification of RR-TB and/or MDR-TB cases - Percentage of notified cases of bacteriologically confirmed, drug resistant RR-TB and/or MDR-TB⃰ as a proportion of the estimated number of RR-TB and/or MDR-TB cases among notified TB cases
Percentage of births attended by skilled health professional
Case notification rate per 100,000 population- bacteriologically-confirmed TB, new and relapse
Treatment success rate - bacteriologically confirmed TB cases
Coverage / Output indicator for AFG-T-MOPH
RSSH-Other1: Number of Health Social Counsellors (HSC) graduated from HSC education program
Percentage of PLHIV on ART who initiated TB preventive therapy among those eligible during the reporting period
SD-Other1: Number of people receiving services through Family Health Houses (FHHs)

Treatment success rate- all forms: Percentage of TB cases, all forms, bacteriologically confirmed plus clinically diagnosed, successfully treated (cured plus treatment completed) among all TB cases registered for treatment during a specified period, new and relapse cases
Number of people in contact with TB patients who began preventive therapy
Number of cases with RR-TB and/or MDR-TB that began second-line treatment
Completeness of facility reporting: Percentage of expected facility monthly reports (for the reporting period) that are actually received
Percentage of cases with RR-TB and/or MDR-TB started on treatment for MDR-TB who were lost to follow up during the first six months of treatment
Percentage of registered new and relapse TB patients with documented HIV status
Number of TB cases with RR-TB and/or MDR-TB notified
Number of children <5 in contact with TB patients who began isonizide preventive therapy
LAB-Other1: Laboratory functionality index
Impact indicator for AFG-T-MOPH
TB mortality rate per 100,000 population
RR-TB and/or MDR-TB prevalence among new TB patients: Proportion of new TB cases with RR-TB and/or MDR-TB
TB incidence rate per 100,000 population
TB prevalence rate per 100,000 population
Under 5 mortality rate per 1000 live births
Maternal mortality ratio, per 100,000 population
